text: I'm aware of the mystery around us, so I write about coincidences, premonitions, emotions, dreams, the power of nature, magic.
author: Isabel Allende

text: There's an easygoing nature that comes with a perspective of things that aren't as important as we make them sometimes.
author: Marguerite Moreau

text: Nature, when she invented, manufactured, and patented her authors, contrived to make critics out of the chips that were left.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: The right of nature... is the liberty each man hath to use his own power, as he will himself, for the preservation of his own nature that is to say, of his own life.
author: Thomas Hobbes

text: Good breeding is the result of good sense, some good nature, and a little self-denial for the sake of others.
author: Lord Chesterfield
